channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘He spent every dime’: My daughter’s husband is in prison. Is she responsible for his debts?
item.description: “He opened credit cards in his name and spent every dime he could get his hands on, gambling and buying vehicles.”

item.title: The meme-stock party is already fizzling out. What that means for the rest of the market.
item.description: The meme-stock craze may have ended before it could flourish, caught up in a summer market and big tech earnings, says Vanda Research.

item.title: Here’s the main reason gold has lost luster after reaching a record high
item.description: Gold has struggled to regain its April highs owing to a variety of factors but central banks slowing down their purchases is the main one

item.title: LangChain’s Align Evals closes the evaluator trust gap with prompt-level calibration
item.description: LangChain allows enterprises to make and calibrate a model to evaluate applications and get it close to human preferences.

item.title: ‘I told him that wouldn’t fly’: My 90-year-old mother’s adviser changed the beneficiaries on her accounts. What is going on?
item.description: “He said, ‘I’m just trying to help.’”

item.title: All the pain for none of the discount: Why small caps are so toxic right now
item.description: It’s a brutal time in small-cap land even as the broader stock market hits new records.

item.title: The two people shaping the future of OpenAI’s research

item.title: Shadow AI adds $670K to breach costs while 97% of enterprises skip basic access controls, IBM reports
item.description: IBM's 2025 Cost of a Data Breach Report reveals that breaches involving unauthorized AI tools now average $4.63M.

item.title: C8 Health started with an AI that gives anesthesiologists guidance on demand — now it’s targeting whole hospitals
item.description: A friendly red panda avatar serves up the knowledge from the organization's own siloed databases, complete with citations

item.title: ‘Subliminal learning’: Anthropic uncovers how AI fine-tuning secretly teaches bad habits
item.description: A common AI fine-tuning practice could be unintentionally poisoning your models with hidden biases and risks, a new Anthropic study warns.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg says ‘developing superintelligence is now in sight,’ shades OpenAI and other firms focused on automating work
item.description: So perhaps, these competing visions of superintelligence are actually far more similar than they are opposed.
